channel.title: PnP PowerShell on Microsoft 365 Community Blog
channel.description: Recent content in PnP PowerShell on Microsoft 365 Community Blog

item.title: PnP PowerShell or CLI for Microsoft 365 or both or other
item.description: During my SP consultant/dev work I most of the times used the last two. From time to time I got the question: which one is better?

item.title: CLI for Microsoft 365 on your mobile
item.description: CLI for Microsoft 365 is a cross platform command line tool you may use to manage many things. To name a few, you may manage OneDrive, Planner, Power Apps and Automate, Teams, Yammer, SharePoint (of course), now there is even a dedicated command to help you set up Viva. The list keeps on growing and growing

item.title: PnP Batch Add or Delete items from very large list, i.e. more than 300k items
item.description: I was tasked to delete more than 300k items loaded as part of testing from a very large SharePoint list, I used the script from the blog postÂ https://vladilen.

item.title: PnP Batch versus Microsoft Graph Batch in PowerShell to add/delete 3k items
item.description: Following on previous blog PnP Batch Add or Delete items from very large list

item.title: Use PnP PowerShell to add a document library web part to a page (and only show a specific folder)
item.description: As a non-developer (please read this as a disclaimer) I still try to make my life as easy as possible (yes, I am that lazy).

item.title: How to to get all site collections with their sub webs using PnP PowerShell?
item.description: Sometimes we have a business requirement to get site collections with all the sub-webs so we can achieve the solution easily using PnP PowerShell.

item.title: How to get any site collection users with their roles using PnP PowerShell?
item.description: Introduction Sometimes we have a requirement to get reports of users and their roles on the SharePoint site and we have to export to CSV/Excel format.
